alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 10:31PM MDT until July 28 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork South Platte River, Buffalo Creek, Cabin Creek, Shinglemill Creek, Elk Creek, South Fork Buffalo Creek, Kelsey Creek, Last Resort Creek, South Platte River, Bear Creek, Gunbarrel Creek, Freeman Creek, Wigwam Creek, Deer Creek, Long Gulch, Willow Creek, Tramway Creek and Spring Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo Creek, Pine Grove, Wellington Lake, South Platte and Foxton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows in steep terrain.
